titles: Die Mercurii 5‚Å∞ Iulii 1648. Resolved, &c. That the House doth declare it an acceptable service in any persons that will list themselves, horse or foot, under the command of Major Generall Skippon, for defence and safety of the Parliament, city and kingdom ...
author: Manley, John.
Skippon, Philip, d. 1660.
notes: Lower half sheet contains the orders, addressed: "To Mr. John Manly ..." and signed "Ph: Skippon."
Contains ms. notes and signature of John Manley.
Reproduction of original in: Birmingham Central Reference Library (Birmingham, England).
